content: Initially, I needed to transfer a profile from the first device to another. But when I opened this profile, I found problems with messages: they had no content. Later, when I transferred a profile from the first device with new messages that were not there, they also broke (their content also disappeared). The transfer was done manually from version 140 to 115. DeepSeek writes that this may be due to significant changes in the data storage structure, but when transferring these messages to another device with version 140, the same problem occurs. My question is whether it is possible to fix such letters or a profile? thanks for the help
creator: artur.hairullin.army

content:
I think the issue may be that the messages are incomplete in the original profile. If IMAP, they will be reconstructed, so the only issue is POP and local folders. Here are the basics for a successful copy: Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

Since you are experiencing problems, I suggest reviewing the message folders in the Mail folder of copied profile after creating it and after importing to Thunderbird. If there is any corruption during the process, that should show it.

Another option is to use the importexporttools NG addon. With that, you could do this: - highlight Local Folders - rightclick and select the importexport option to import mbox - then, select one of the message folders in exported profile and select OK. If the messages were complete prior to the export, this should bring them in to the new profile.
creator: davidsk

content: Please provide more information, as I am unclear on your issue. Thank you.

content: There seems to be a bug that might affect you. Click 'account settings' and see if you have not defined a default account. It is easy to verify as there will be a star icon on the same line as the account name. After setting a default account, exit and restart thunderbird and I think it will work properly.
creator: davidsk

content: If the original profile is still available, I recommend discarding the zip file and using traditional means to copy the profile. Let me know and I will provide details on doing that. If that is not an option, I suggest exporting the zip file so you can copy key components into a new profile. On that: - install thunderbird with a default profile. click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder', click 'open folder' - now exit thunderbird. you are in the profile itself - from the unzipped profile, your addressbook is abook.sqlite and history.sqlite. Copy both of those to the root folder of the new profile - from Mail\Local Folders, copy all to Mail\Local Folders in new profile - IMAP will automatically repopulate so no worry - if POP accounts, now restart thunderbird, set to OFFLINE, and set up the POP account. do NOT retrieve messages. now exit thunderbird and copy the Mail\<POP account> folder to the Mail\<POP account> folder in new profile. Now restart thunderbird.
creator: davidsk

content: Bedoelt u dat u alle mappen en dergelijke kwijt bent en de account opnieuw hebt moeten configureren? Zo ja, dan is er een nieuw profiel aangemaakt. Kijk dan of het oude Gebruikersgegevens herstellen die na een Thunderbird-update zijn verdwenen profiel nog bestaat. Als de gegevens er nog wel zijn, maar u ontvangt geen berichten meer kijk dan op Kan geen berichten ontvangen.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: Meer uitleg over hoe Thunderbird gegevens bewaart staat in dit artikel: https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/wachtwoordenbeheerder-onthouden-verwijderen-tb. Zijn de servergegevens toevallig aangepast of is er gewisseld van POP naar IMAP vv? U kunt altijd de bestaande gegevens verwijderen en opnieuw invoeren en dan laten bewaren door Thunderbird.
